definition: Gutenberg (name)/Johannes Gutenberg (c. 1400-1468), inventor in Europe of the printing press/Beno Gutenberg (1889-1960), German-born US seismologist, coinventor of the Richter magnitude scale
surname Gu
ancient/old/paleo-

to scale (a height)/to ascend/to mount/to publish or record/to enter (e.g. in a register)/to press down with the foot/to step or tread on/to put on (shoes or trousers) (dialect)/to be gathered and taken to the threshing ground (old)
an earthwork/castle/position of defense/stronghold/used in place names, often as phonetic bao for "burg" or "bad"
variant of 鋪|铺[pu4]/used in place names

sentences.english: He called his enterprise Project Gutenberg.
sentences.chinese: 他把这个工程叫作古登堡计划。

sentences.english: Project Gutenberg has tons of olde-books you can download for free.
sentences.chinese: 古登堡计划拥有大量的旧的电子书，可以免费下载。

sentences.english: Project Gutenberg has tons of old e-books you can download for free.
